newsitem.title: DUBAI: Force 5.5 quake hits eastern Iran-IRNA.
newsitem.headline: Force 5.5 quake hits eastern Iran-IRNA.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.5 on the Richter scale jolted eastern Iran on Monday, the same area hit by a strong quake which killed more than 1,500 people in May.
The official Iranian news agency IRNA said the quake hit the areas of Qaen and Birjand at 7.30 a.m. (0300 GMT), but that there were no reports yet on casualties or damage.
An earthquake of force four or more could cause serious damage in populated areas.

An earthquake measuring 7.1 on the Richter scale hit the area last month leaving 1,560 dead, 2,810 injured and 50,000 homeless. It flattened 200 villages and prompted Iran to appeal for international aid.
Iran was hit by three major earthquakes in the past year as well as scores of milder tremors and thousands of aftershocks that U.N. officials say have stretched Iran's relief supplies to the limit.
